intro: Meibomia distorta var. macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf meibomia, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves that can grow up to 15 cm in length. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The varietal name *macrophylla* refers to its large, showy leaves, which are a distinguishing feature of this variant.
